title: Thailand-Cambodia clash: How Hindu temple is at centre of deadly border dispute
content: Tensions between Thailand and Cambodia have escalated into deadly violence along their contested border, marked by exchanges of fire, airstrikes, and diplomatic expulsions. The conflict, rooted in a century-old dispute over the Preah Vihear temple and surrounding land, has seen both nations accusing each other of aggression.

title: Pahalgam echo: PM Modi again uses English mid-speech, this time for Khalistanis
content: During a joint press conference, Prime Minister Modi's lighthearted reassurance to a translator, who briefly stumbled between Hindi and English, drew chuckles. Moments later, Modi strategically switched to English while addressing global terror, delivering a stern message to Khalistani groups and Western nations. He emphasized accountability for those abusing democratic freedoms.

title: Ahmedabad air crash: Inside 10-second mystery - What really brought down AI171?
content: The Air India Flight AI 171 crash is under investigation, focusing on ten critical seconds in the cockpit. A Bloomberg report highlights unexplained actions, including the simultaneous cutoff of engine fuel switches shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad. Confusion and delays in resetting the switches, coupled with the aircraft's low altitude, prevented engine reignition.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: India-UK trade deal: Exports, jobs and more - FTA in 10 big numbers
content: The India-UK trade deal marks a significant milestone, granting 99% of Indian exports duty-free access to the UK market. This agreement is poised to boost bilateral trade by £25.5 billion, reducing tariffs on various sectors and fostering growth in textiles, agriculture, engineering, and pharmaceuticals.

title: Fighter jets: Flying towards scary parity with Pakistan; are drones the solution?
content: With the last MiG-21s getting phased out, IAF will have almost the same number of fighter squadrons as Pakistan’s air force. And it can get worse. Here’s why

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai says, smartphones are not going anywhere
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai believes smartphones will remain dominant for at least two to three years, despite heavy investment in AR glasses. While excited about AR's potential, Pichai emphasizes a measured approach, viewing it as complementary rather than a replacement for phones. This contrasts with Apple's predictions of smartphones becoming obsolete within a decade, as they aggressively develop head-mounted devices.

title: British cars could cost less as UK-India FTA signed but what's the catch?
content: India and the UK have signed a Free Trade Agreement that will lower import duties on select British cars to 10 percent under a quota system. This benefits high-end models from Jaguar Land Rover's UK portfolio, like the Range Rover SV, and potentially Mini models.

title: Jaguars & jobs: How FTA with UK will benefit India - and what it means for your wallet
content: The India-UK free trade agreement, signed recently, promises significant gains for India, including duty-free access to UK markets for 99% of exports. This landmark deal is set to boost job opportunities in labor-intensive sectors, reduce tariffs on British goods like cars and whiskey, and increase agricultural exports.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China diktat' to employees
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: Justice Varma case: Speaker Birla to announce inquiry panel to probe charges
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla is set to form a high-level inquiry committee to investigate allegations against Allahabad High Court Judge Yashwant Varma, following a notice signed by 152 MPs. Consultations are underway to establish the three-member panel, as mandated by the Judges (Inquiry) Act, involving coordination with the Rajya Sabha, where a similar notice was submitted.

title: Now Trump says he wants Musk’s companies to 'thrive like never before'
content: Donald Trump has softened his stance on Elon Musk, dismissing claims he would dismantle Musk's companies by revoking federal subsidies. Trump asserted he wants Musk and all American businesses to thrive, believing their success benefits the entire nation.

title: 'No current plans': Centre on removing 'socialism', 'secularism' from Preamble
content: The central government clarified on Thursday that there are "no current plans" to remove 'socialism' and 'secularism' from the Preamble, despite recent calls for review. Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal stated that any changes would require broad consensus, which is not initiated yet.

title: 'Act against those who misuse freedom': PM Modi to Starmer on Khalistan threat in UK
content: Prime Minister Modi urged his UK counterpart to act against extremist ideologies exploiting democratic freedoms, amidst rising pro-Khalistani influence in Britain. Modi emphasized the need to hold accountable those who undermine democracy, following the signing of a free trade agreement. He also addressed the extradition of economic offenders, assuring coordinated efforts.

title: Justin Fields injury scare: Jets QB carted off with leg pain; season opener now in doubt
content: During the Jets' training camp on July 24, 2025, Justin Fields suffered a right leg injury, necessitating his removal from the field via cart. The severity of the injury is currently unknown, but veteran Tyrod Taylor is poised to step in as quarterback if Fields is sidelined. The Jets' coaching staff expresses hope that the injury is not serious.

title: 'Leave me out of it' : YesJulz breaks silence as LeBron gets slammed
content: LeBron James ignited controversy by dancing to Kendrick Lamar's Drake diss track in Cannes, drawing social media influencer YesJulz into the fray. Years after infidelity rumors involving James surfaced, YesJulz has now broken her silence, posting "Leave me out of it" on X. The rumors began in 2014 when James played for the Miami Heat.

title: 'Unacceptable': India on CPEC expansion, slams China-Pak-Afghanistan meet
content: India has firmly reiterated its opposition to the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), deeming its expansion or third-party involvement, including Afghanistan's, as unacceptable. Minister Kirti Vardhan Singh informed the Rajya Sabha that India has consistently protested CPEC's inclusion in the Belt and Road Initiative, as it traverses Indian territories under Pakistan's illegal occupation.

title: Cars, whisky & leather: All about multi-billion dollar India-UK FTA
content: India-UK free trade deal: In a landmark move, India and the UK have formalized a free trade agreement aimed at boosting bilateral trade to $120 billion by 2030. The agreement, signed by key ministers and witnessed by both Prime Ministers, will reduce tariffs on various goods, benefiting both nations' economies.

title: 'Era of development, not expansionism': PM Modi's stern message to China
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke against expansionism. He indirectly referred to China's actions in the Indo-Pacific. This statement occurred during a press briefing with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. Both leaders discussed peace and stability. They also addressed the Ukraine conflict and West Asia situation. Respect for sovereignty is essential. China's assertiveness is a global concern.

title: IND vs ENG: Jagadeesan set to be added as a cover for injured Pant; waiting for visa
content: N Jagadeesan is likely to join the Indian team in England as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant, who suffered a metatarsal fracture. With Ishan Kishan also injured, selectors turned to Jagadeesan, currently awaiting visa processing. Pant had injured his toe on the opening day of the fourth Test while attempting a reverse sweep.

title: Thailand-Cambodia face-off: Borders shut, F-16 deployed, civilians killed
content: Recent clashes between Thailand and Cambodia over disputed border territories near ancient temples have escalated, resulting in casualties and diplomatic breakdowns. Thailand expelled the Cambodian ambassador following a landmine incident, while Cambodia retaliated by downgrading ties. Military exchanges intensified, with both sides accusing each other of aggression, including airstrikes and artillery fire.

title: Asia Cup: India, Pakistan likely to be in same group; BCCI to announce schedule
content: The Asia Cup 2025, slated to be held in the UAE, is set to feature a highly anticipated India versus Pakistan clash. BCCI's Rajiv Shukla and ACC president and PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi will finalise venues and schedules soon. Despite heightened tensions, the BCCI is seeking government permission for the match, with the tournament acting as preparation for the T20 World Cup.

title: 'Did HC apply mind?' SC slams K'taka court over bail to Darshan in murder case
content: The Supreme Court expressed strong displeasure with the Karnataka High Court's handling of actor Darshan's bail in the Renukaswamy murder case. Justice Pardiwala questioned the High Court's approach. He suggested the bail order resembled an acquittal. The Karnataka government sought cancellation of Darshan's bail. Renukaswamy was allegedly abducted and murdered in Bengaluru.

title: Indian caught shoplifting: Singapore arrests man, goods worth Rs 3 lakh stolen
content: An Indian man was apprehended at Singapore's Changi Airport for allegedly stealing perfumes, cosmetics, and bags worth over S$5,136 from 14 stores. Police identified him from CCTV footage after a bag went missing from a Jewel Changi retail outlet. He was arrested upon his return to Singapore while transiting through the airport, and the stolen items were recovered.

title: IND vs ENG : Can Ishan step in as cover for injured Pant? No he can't
content: Ishan Kishan, initially considered as Rishabh Pant's replacement for the fifth Test match, is unfit due to an ankle injury sustained in a driving accident, resulting in ten stitches and a plaster cast. While the BCCI hasn't officially confirmed, TimesofIndia.com can confirm Pant has a fractured toe which will require extensive rehabilitation.

title: NEET PG 2025: What forced hundreds of TN aspirants to travel across states?
content: NEET PG 2025 aspirants from Tamil Nadu are in a fix. Many got exam centres in Andhra Pradesh, far from their home state. This unexpected allotment causes logistical and financial problems. The Tamil Nadu Resident Doctors Association has appealed to the Union Health Ministry. They seek reallocation of centres within Tamil Nadu. Students and associations urge immediate intervention.

title: IND vs ENG Test: BCCI issue statement on Pant's injury - latest update
content: Rishabh Pant's right foot injury during the fourth Test at Old Trafford has sidelined him from wicket-keeping duties, with Dhruv Jurel stepping in. Despite the setback, Pant may bat if needed. His absence compounds India's challenges, adding to a growing injury list including key players.

title: Man parades 8-month-old son upside down in UP village over dowry
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Rampur district, a shocking video surfaced showing a man parading his 8-month-old child upside down, sparking public outrage. Police intervened after the video went viral on July 19, 2025, booking the father for disturbing public peace. The incident stemmed from a marital dispute, with the wife alleging dowry demands of Rs 2 lakh and a car.

title: Bengaluru stampede victim's mother claims gold earrings vanished after autopsy
content: A family alleges theft of gold jewelry from their daughter's body during the post-mortem following the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede in Bengaluru, which claimed 11 lives after an RCB victory parade. The father filed a complaint at the Commercial Street police station. The stampede occurred due to poor crowd control, with an estimated 3 lakh people gathering.

title: Planning a US trip? Trump's new policy may add extra Rs 20k to your visa cost - check details
content: The Trump administration's new policy introduces a $250 "visa integrity fee" for non-immigrant visa applicants, impacting tourists, students, and business travelers from countries like India and China. This fee, in addition to the existing $185 application cost, raises concerns within the tourism industry, with leaders fearing it will deter international visitors.

title: Climate change alert: 100 dams in 6 Himalayan states at risk
content: In response to escalating risks from glacial lake outburst floods (GLOFs), the Central Water Commission has issued new guidelines for over 100 dams across six Himalayan states. These directives, prompted by climate change-induced glacier melt and increasing glacial lakes, mandate enhanced spillway capacity for new dams and retrofitting measures for existing ones.

title: IND vs ENG | Woakes breaks silence on hitting Pant's toe: 'I didn’t think...'
content: Chris Woakes discussed the delivery that injured Rishabh Pant's toe, leading to a fracture and his withdrawal from the ongoing Test series. Woakes suspected Pant might attack, so he bowled a slower, fuller ball that struck Pant's foot unexpectedly. Scans revealed a fracture, and Ishan Kishan is likely to replace him as wicketkeeper.

title: Training, safety issues: DGCA slaps Air India with 4 show-cause notices
content: The DGCA has issued a stern warning to Air India, threatening action over safety violations, including crew fatigue management and training protocols. The regulator cited 29 violations, such as insufficient pilot rest, poor simulator training compliance, and inadequate crew on international routes. This follows Air India's self-reporting of issues after a plane crash in Ahmedabad.

title: Burning fuselage found: Russian plane with 49 on board crashes; no survivors
content: A plane carrying 50 individuals disappeared in Russia's far east on Thursday after losing contact with air traffic control. Operated by Angara airline, the aircraft was nearing Tynda in the Amur region, bordering China. Communication ceased just kilometers from its destination, prompting immediate concern and initiating search efforts to locate the missing aircraft and its passengers.

title: Locals thrash 'drunk' Indore cop for 'visiting' married woman’s house
content: In Indore's Khajrana area, a sub-inspector named Suresh Bunkar faced a brutal assault by women and locals after being found inside a woman's house early Thursday. Accused of being drunk and misbehaving, he was beaten, and attempts were made to strip him.

title: Donald Trump’s indicates he won’t go below 15% tariff rate; says 'we’ll have a straight…'
content: US President Donald Trump has signaled a potential shift in trade strategy, suggesting a baseline tariff of 15% for most nations, potentially reaching 50% for countries with strained relations. This move marks a departure from pursuing individual trade agreements, with Trump indicating tariff letters as completed deals.

title: This Filipino couple got married in a submerged church; here's why
content: In a remarkable display of resilience, a Filipino couple exchanged vows in a flooded church near Manila, highlighting the country's struggle with chronic flooding. The wedding proceeded despite knee-deep water caused by monsoon rains and Typhoon Wipha, symbolizing the couple's commitment amidst adversity.

title: Rishabh Pant fractures toe: From free-wheeling shots to moon boot - how events unfolded
content: In a significant setback for India, Rishabh Pant is likely out for the England Test series due to a toe fracture. Scans revealed a compound fracture after Pant was hit on the boot during the fourth Test, potentially sidelining him for six to eight weeks. He retired hurt and was taken to a medical facility.

title: ‘It’s Loktantra, not Loktantar’: BJP mocks spelling error in oppn banner
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has criticized the opposition for a spelling error on a banner during a protest concerning electoral roll revisions in Bihar. The opposition alleges that the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of voter rolls is being misused to suppress votes.

title: Opposition to opt for consensus candidate in V-P election unlike 2022
content: Trinamool and AAP abstained from the 2022 election after Congress went against the broader agreement and fielded party veteran Margaret Alva; 55 members stayed away from that election

title: Mother of stampede victim files theft case
content: In her complaint, Ashwini said that the earrings, which were gifted by her brother to Divyanshi a year and a half ago, were found missing when the body was handed over to her

title: Amit Shah unveils National Cooperation Policy 2025
content: Cooperatives will help people achieve aspirations requiring capital, says Mr. Shah; Ministry has made detailed plans for cooperatives in taxi services, insurance, tourism, and green energy sectors

title: Rameshwaram Cafe files complaint about blackmail and extortion
content: The cafe said that earlier there were several attempts where people with malafide intentions voluntarily put insects, stones in the food, and were caught red handed in some of their other outlets

title: After Giridhari, JD(U) MLA opposes ongoing SIR in Bihar
content: AIMIM MLA Aktharul Iman raises concern over alleged discrimination against the Muslim population in the Seemanchal region, terms SIR as EC’s Tughlaqi farman

title: Pass on benefits of import duty cuts in edible to consumers: Minister to industries
content: Union Food Minister Pralhad Joshi was addressing a round-table meeting organised by the Indian Vegetable Oil Producers’ Association

title: Committee to look into ‘legal structure’ for India Meteorological Department
content: Despite being the official source of monsoon forecasts, cyclone warnings, and all aspects involving weather, there is no single law that defines the structure, function and responsibilities of the IMD

title: PIL filed to bring Sarasvati Mahal Library under national mission
content: Petitionery says the library is languishing under administrative neglect, staff shortage, unimplemented digitisation, and because of lack of preservation efforts

title: Cabinet directs action on two officials for Tirupati stampede
content: It approves the one-man panel report on the incident; clears various proposals related to BC Welfare Dept., Tourism, Agriculture and road works in Amaravati

title: Gang involved in series of palladium carbon theft across country caught by Sangareddy police
content: Approximately 38 kilograms of palladium carbon, a mild hydrogenation catalyst, worth ₹1.52 crore was seized from the three-member gang.

title: Operation Sindoor fallout: Chinese-made surveillance gear banned, aerial monitoring boosted for Independence Day
content: Defence Ministry took over Red Fort venue on July 15; radar, anti-drone systems to be deployed as UAVs, UAS are a key security concern; CCTV vendors directed not to install equipment made in China

title: Over 61 lakh voters may be out of Bihar’s draft electoral roll, says ECI data on the eve of SIR deadline
content: A day before the deadline, 7 lakh yet to submit forms; also 21.6 lakh dead, 31.5 lakh left the State, 1 lakh untraceable; claims of missing names or wrongful inclusions can be filed till September 1

title: Road transport corporation employees to launch indefinite strike on August 5
content: They are demanding release of pending wage arrears as part of the implementation of 2024 wage revision

title: Former CM Jairam Thakur criticises Congress government over disaster relief in Himachal Pradesh
content: The BJP leader, who is the Leader of Opposition in the State Assembly, alleges slow and inadequate response; BJP delegation meets Union Ministers seeking additional support

title: Ruckus in Belagavi council over MES member’s demand for govt. documents in Marathi
content: The council member belonging to Maharashtra Ekikaran Samiti Ravi Salunke sought documents and council proceedings in Marathi

title: DNA Networks moves Karnataka HC against report of Commission of Inquiry on stampede
content: John Michael Cunha, a retired judge of the High Court of Karnataka, had conducted the inquiry under the provisions of the Commissions of Inquiry (CoI) Act, 1952, on the terms and reference notified by the State government

title: Naidu heads for Singapore tomorrow to regain trust, investments
content: Chief Minister’s six-day schedule includes meetings with CEOs, and Telugu diaspora from Singapore and neighbouring countries

title: Supreme Court working with govt. to clear pending HC appointments: CJI
content: Petitions question government’s unexplainable delay and unilateral segregation of names recommended by Collegium

title: ‘Mittayi’ turns a bitter pill for children with Type 1 diabetes, parents in Kerala
content: Experts are of the view that slow-acting insulin, which is being given to children aged above five, is not suitable for children up to the age of 10. Earlier, rapid-acting insulin was given to all the beneficiaries.

title: With 74 nominations, Kerala film forum AMMA to witness fierce electoral battle
content: Actors’ body divided over members accused of misconduct in the Hema Committee contesting in the election scheduled for August 15

title: Several organisations plan mega protest against mining policy in Ballari on Aug. 16
content: They condemn what they term retrograde and dangerous policies on mining by the State and Union governments

title: Call to sanction more funds for midday meal scheme
content: Schoolteachers’ organisations argue that it is not practical to provide food to students as per the revised uniform menu for ₹6.78 allowed to lower primary schools as material cost

title: D.K. Shivakumar asserts that Karnataka will go ahead with Mahadayi project
content: The Deputy Chief Minister also reiterated that the State would try to take an all-party leaders’ delegation to Delhi to convince the Centre about the need to provide all clearances for the proposed project

title: Every SC/ST complaint must lead to registration of FIR without any preliminary inquiry, orders Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan also orders only officers not below the rank of DSP must conduct the investigation and file final reports within 60 days

title: Raichur City Corporation launches robotic scavenger to clean manholes
content: Bandicoot will play a key role in improving public services and ensuring safety while upholding the dignity of every sanitation worker

title: Rain gains strength, orange alert for six districts in Kerala on Friday
content: Rainfall and wind will be strengthened further from Friday as the remnant of the tropical cyclone Wipha has taken the shape of a low pressure

title: AI-powered policing takes off as Kalaburagi gets smart drones for a first in the State
content: The initiative marks the beginning of a technology-driven policing model and lays the foundation for a skilled drone task force across the State

title: Srisailam geared up for auspicious ‘Sravana Masam’
content: Sparsha darshan will be provided to the devotees in three slots on days when there would be rush, while it has been cancelled completely from August 15 to 18 for the convenience of the common devotees

title: A.P. Cabinet approves ₹80,000 crore investment proposals
content: Incentives, subsidies, land allotments, Amaravati Green Hydrogen Valley declaration and phase-1 of Vizag and Vijayawada metro rail projects get the nod

title: Over 12,000 teaching posts vacant in Kendriya and Navodaya Vidyalayas: Education Ministry
content: "A total of 7,765 teacher posts in Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan and 4,323 teacher posts in Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti are lying vacant across the country as of date," Union Minister of State for Education Jayant Chaudhary said in the response.

title: Anti-rabies vaccination drive for stray dogs in Tholur panchayat in Thrissur
content: Initiative is supported by panchayat’s project funds. Veterinary team covers various wards of panchayat and administers vaccines to over a hundred stray dogs

title: NEET-PG aspirants from Kerala in distress over allotment of exam centres in A.P., Telangana
content: Every year, at least 20-24,000 students appear for the NEET-PG exam from Kerala. There are 13 exam centres in Kerala for the online exam.

title: Seven years on, govt puts out new telecom policy draft
content: Following the 2018 National Digital Communications Policy, the 2025 refresh seeks to create more jobs, rejuvenate the domestic telecom industry, and expand India’s influence on global standardisation talks for 6G.

title: Flood threat looms over Pathanamthitta and Kottayam as rainfall persists
content: Water levels surged across all major rivers in Pathanamthitta, including the Manimala, the Pampa and the Achencoil, prompting the Central Water Commission to issue a yellow alert for all three. In neighbouring Kottayam, the incessant rainfall has swelled rivers and streams, with major rivers like the Meenachil witnessing a surge as runoff from the highlands flowed downstream

title: Bills related to abolition of child marriages, regulation of private ambulance, gig workers’ welfare to be tabled in Monsoon Session
content: Under Karnataka Prohibition of Child Marriage (Amendment) Bill, 2025, all legislators, leaders and elders involved in a child’s engagement or marriage would be punished

title: BU syndicate to seek restriction on public vehicle entry into Jnana Bharathi campus
content: More than 25,000 vehicles pass through the campus daily, causing serious disturbances to academic activities and leading to multiple accidents

title: Guard against infiltration amid Assam eviction drive: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma
content: Conrad K. Sangma seeks coordination with NGOs and traditional heads to prevent illegal movement or infiltration by the evicted people

title: Traffic congestion turns worse at TVS Tollgate Junction as Panjapur bus terminus becomes fully functional in Tiruchi
content: Many commuters board or alight the long-distance buses at TVS Tollgate Junction, activists suggest creating of parking lot at a busy spot to prevent random parking of vehicles

title: No current plan or intention to reconsider or remove 'socialism', 'secularism' from Preamble: Government
content: In a written reply, Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal said while there may be discussions or debates in certain public or political circles, "no formal decision or proposal has been announced by the government" regarding amendments to these terms.

title: Private medical colleges increase fees for management, NRI quota seats in the range of ₹1 lakh to ₹6 lakh
content: Despite the State govt. order that the annual fee for management and NRI quota seats cannot exceed ₹45 lakh, many private medical colleges have crossed the limit

title: The NFL's All-Under-Pressure Team: 15 people with something huge on the line in 2025
content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: Source: Jets QB Fields' toe injury not significant
content: Jets quarterback Justin Fields was carted off the practice field after suffering a toe injury on his right foot, though a source told ESPN that the injury is not considered significant.

title: Canada hockey trial judge: Onus of proof not met
content: An Ontario judge is delivering her ruling in the sexual assault trial of five former members of Canada's world junior hockey team, saying she did not find the complainant's testimony to be credible.

title: Hackett rejoins Packers, this time to help on D
content: Former Jets offensive coordinator and Broncos head coach Nathaniel Hackett returned to his roots with the Packers as a defensive analyst.

title: Fever's Cunningham fined for criticizing referees
content: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham has been fined $500 for a social media post criticizing the league's referees, she wrote on X.

title: USC freshman Arenas injures knee, out 6-8 months
content: USC freshman Alijah Arenas, who was the No. 13 recruit in the ESPN 100, will need surgery after injuring his knee and will sit out six to eight months, the school announced.

title: Dolphins' Matos still in hospital for observation
content: Dolphins offensive lineman Bayron Matos remained under observation at the Ryder Trauma Care Center at Jackson Memorial Hospital on Thursday.

title: Packers: Received $432.6M in revenue sharing
content: The Packers, the NFL's only publicly owned team, revealed that the national revenue sharing from the previous fiscal year was a record $432.6 million.

title: Rays option Bradley to minors after rough start
content: The Rays optioned Taj Bradley to Triple-A Durham following a poor start for the inconsistent right-hander Wednesday night.

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: NL team debuts at No. 1
content:
Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

👟 Clark surprises Iowa with Nike Kobe 5 Protros

title: MLB trade dominoes: Predicting where the 10 biggest names on the market will land
content: Based on what ESPN's Jeff Passan is hearing, we predict where the top trade candidates will land -- and how they affect each other.

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal? Best pick?
content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo polled executives and scouts on this NBA season's upcoming rookie class. Who will win ROY? Which players will surpass expectations?

title: 'It's 100% addictive': Cowboys coach Schottenheimer reveals the meaning of his tattoos
content: From his "whys" to his "life license plate," Schottenheimer explains his ink and what he'll do if he wins a Super Bowl.

title: We ranked the 50 most impactful NFL offseason moves
content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1?

title: Pete Rose history on display at Baseball Hall of Fame
content: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum's archives contain dozens of items related to MLB's hits king.

title: In the wake of tragedy, can Liverpool win a second straight Premier League title?
content: Diogo Jota's death casts an immense shadow over Liverpool's preseason preparations, but new arrivals have strengthened the squad. Could the Reds win the Premier League title again?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

title: Greene to join exclusive club? Luzardo turns it around? Don't be surprised
content: Let's take a look into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: "If he failed, their process failed": Inside the NFLPA meltdown
content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Odunze, McCarthy among favorite breakouts for 2025
content: Which players can you count on to break out in 2025? Our experts go around the league and identify six that stand out.

title: Deion Sanders on hand at Shilo's first Bucs training camp practice
content: The Colorado Buffaloes head coach also held conversations with the Buccaneers head coach and head of player engagement at the practice.

title: Packers unveil throwback uniforms for 2025 season
content: The jerseys are a tribute to a 1923 season that was "as big a year as there's been in Packer history."

title: No Messi, no Alba: Can the MLS All-Star Game be fixed, and where does it go from here?
content: With some of the league's biggest stars absent, MLS must find a way to boost the profile of the All-Star Game.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: While the top three squads from last week's power rankings remain steady, the Whipsnakes have moved up to the No. 4 spot.

title: Pound for pound: Shakur, 'Bam' Rodriguez move up after exciting wins
content: Oleksandr Usyk is still No. 1, but where do Shakur Stevenson and Jesse Rodriguez land? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Divisional: Pacquiao reenters welterweight top 10
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: India added 17 cr jobs in 8 yrs; female participation tops 40%
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce and can navigate the complexities of the business world .

title: Reliance MF Invested Rs 2,850 Crore In YES Bank, Siphoned Off: Sources
content: Businessman Anil Ambani's Reliance Mutual Fund invested Rs 2,850 crore in AT-1 bonds of YES Bank for suspected quid pro quo, sources in the Enforcement Directorate have said.

title: 'Worm In Food Video Staged For Rs 25 Lakh Extortion': Rameshwaram Cafe
content: A popular south Indian restaurant brand has filed a police complaint against a group of people who it said allegedly tried to malign the brand and extort money by staging a false incident of food contamination at its Bengaluru airport outlet.

title: Why Trump Makes A U-Turn On Musk And Wants 'Elon To Thrive Like Never Before'
content: US President Donald Trump clarified on Thursday that he wants Elon Musk and his companies to "thrive". He said he wanted all businesses within the US to "thrive like never before".

title: Delhi Likely To Witness Rain With Thunderstorms Tomorrow: Weather Office
content: The national capital on Thursday recorded a maximum temperature of 35.9 degrees Celsius, one degree above the season's average, the weather office said.

title: Decision On 'Rummy-Playing' Minister Likely On Monday, Says Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar said a decision on agriculture minister Manikrao Kokate -- who was caught on camera allegedly playing an online card game in assembly -- will be taken after a meeting with the Chief Minister.

title: Assam Agents Use Dead Man's ID To Get Passport For Bangladeshi Man, Arrested
content: Two men have been arrested in Assam for allegedly trying to get an Indian passport for a Bangladeshi national using fake documents created in the name of an Indian citizen who had passed away.

title: US Lawmaker Presses Defense For Details On Microsoft's Chinese Engineers
content: A US lawmaker on Thursday pressed the US Defense Department for further details on what information the US military shared with Chinese engineers as part of a cloud computing services contract with Microsoft.

title: India Secures Zero Duty On 95% Farm Goods Exports In UK Trade Deal
content: India has protected the interests of domestic farmers by excluding dairy products, edible oils, and apples in the free trade agreement (FTA) with the UK while securing zero duties on 95 per cent of agriculture and processed food items.

title: French President And Wife Sue Candace Owens In Gender Rumour Case
content: A lawyer for France 's first couple said they'll be seeking "substantial" damages from US conservative influencer Candace Owens if she persists with claims that President Emmanuel Macron 's wife, Brigitte, is a man.

title: Decision On 'Rummy-Playing' Minister Likely On Monday, Says Ajit Pawar
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar said a decision on agriculture minister Manikrao Kokate -- who was caught on camera allegedly playing an online card game in assembly -- will be taken after a meeting with the Chief Minister.

title: Adani Enterprises To Partner With MetTube For Copper Tubes Business
content: Adani group flagship company will divest 50 per cent of its copper tubes business to MetTube, while simultaneously acquiring a 50 per cent stake in MetTube's Indian unit, the company said on Thursday.

title: ED Raids 6 Sites In Hyderabad Over Rs 621 Crore Scam Linked To Highway Project
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches across six locations in Hyderabad in connection with a Rs 621-crore bank-fraud case against the promoters and directors of a company and its associate firms.

title: Slight Turn, Then Gone: Tractor Swept Away On Flooded Road In Odisha
content: After heavy rains triggered a flood-like situation in an Odisha town located on the banks of the Mahanadi, the state's largest river, a tractor overturned and was swept away, dragged into the swirling waters by the strong current in the flooded area.

title: Punjab Cop Caught Lighting Up, Puffing A Joint On Camera, Transferred
content: A video of a member of the Punjab police taking drugs is being widely circulated, bringing home how deep the state's drug menace has spread its tentacles. The policeman has been identified and action has been taken against him.

title: Passenger Gives Birth To Boy Onboard Air India Express' Muscat-Mumbai Flight
content: A baby boy was born to a woman from Thailand onboard an Air India Express flight enroute to the city from Muscat on Thursday.

title: From Waterlogging To Traffic In Gurugram: What Minister ML Khattar Told NDTV
content: Union Urban Affairs Minister Manohar Lal Khattar, who served as the Chief Minister of Haryana for 10 years from 2014 to 2024, said connectivity has improved in Gurugram and traffic during normal days, when it doesn't rain, has improved.

title: Supreme Court Issues Notice To Assam Chief Secretary Over Goalpara Demolition Drive
content: The Supreme Court issued notice on a plea seeking contempt action against the Assam Chief Secretary and other officials for allegedly conducting a mass eviction and demolition drive in Goalpara's Hasila Beel in violation of the apex court guidelines.

title: "Lost Mental Balance": DK Shivakumar Slams Goa Chief Minister Over Mahadayi Row
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar on Thursday hit back at Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant over his remarks on the Mahadayi river project, saying he had "lost his mental balance" and that the state would proceed with the project.

title: Afghan Girls Turn To Madrassas Amid Education Ban By Taliban
content: For six hours every day after school, Nahideh works in a cemetery, collecting water from a nearby shrine to sell to mourners visiting loved ones' graves. She dreams of becoming a doctor - but knows it is a futile dream.

title: Snake Rescuers In Maharashtra To Get ID Cards, Accident Insurance: Minister
content: The Maharashtra government plans to provide snake rescuers with identity cards and accident insurance coverage of Rs 10 lakh to recognise their services in lessening human-wildlife conflicts, Revenue Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule said.

title: AI 171 crash fallout: Increase in sick leaves by pilots; peaked at 112 on June 16

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5
content: 11 five-star prospects have declared, including two recent commits . the longhorns are making themselves comfortable within SEC country . they landed running back Derrick Cooper, a one-time Georgia commit . Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day

title: One month until college football: Swing games for every Top 25 team
content: a month away from college football, we asked our reporters to single out one contest for each of our post-spring Top 25 teams that could swing their season one way or the other . some will come in major nonconference battles over the first couple of weeks, some are more traditional league games that could set the tone for the things to come .

title: Semifinal talking points: Bonmatí's genius, England's luck, too few teams?
content: defending champions England needed a 96th-minute equalizer and a penalty in extra time to overcome Italy . but both teams struggled through their semifinals to get there . the tournament is down the final two, and it's a repeat of the 2023 world cup final .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How can Whittaker bounce back vs. de Ridder at UFC Fight Night?
content: Reinier de Ridder claims a second-round TKO to give bo Nickal his first career UFC loss . the pair will host their first of two 2025 fight cards in Abu Dhabi this weekend . he suffered a first-round submission loss against Khamzat Chimaev in his last Octagon appearance .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: Rebuild rankings: How close 14 teams are to title contention
